com.dropbox.sync.android

Class DbxFileSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem

  • public class DbxFileSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides access to the files and folders in a user's Dropbox. Get an instance using forAccount(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxAccount).

    DbxFileSystem automatically synchronizes changes with the Dropbox server in the background. Changes made via DbxFileSystem will be automatically uploaded. Remote changes to file and folder metadata will be automatically downloaded. Remote changes to file content will be downloaded when you open a DbxFile.

    A DbxFileSystem instance is specific to a linked user account, and will become unusable if the account is unlinked.

    Background syncing of metadata will remain active if there are changes to upload or download, or if there are any listeners registered (via addPathListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.PathListener, com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxPath, com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.PathListener.Mode)) or DbxFile.addListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFile.Listener)). Otherwise, syncing will be paused (to preserve battery life) until you access DbxFileSystem. If syncing isn't active, and you want to ensure up-to-date data, call syncNowAndWait() to force a metadata update.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  DbxFileSystem.PathListener
      A listener to be called when there is a change to the metadata or contents of a file or folder at a given path, or its descendants.
      static interface  DbxFileSystem.SyncStatusListener
      A listener to be called when there is a change to the status of background synchronization, as reported by getSyncStatus().

    • Method Detail

      • forAccount

        public static DbxFileSystem forAccount(DbxAccount acct)
                                throws DbxException.Unauthorized
        Fetches or creates the appropriate FileSystem for the given account.
        Parameters:
        acct - the DbxAccount defining the user's Dropbox.
        Returns:
        the DbxFileSystem instance for the given account.
        Throws:
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the account is unlinked.

      • shutDown

        public void shutDown()
        Shuts down this filesystem and stops background synchronization. It isn't necessary to call this method before an app terminates, but you can call it to ensure that background synchronization is stopped and resources freed immediately.

        Before stopping the DbxFileSystem you should ensure that all DbxFiles are closed, or outstanding changes may be lost. Local modifications that haven't yet been uploaded will remain queued for upload the next time a DbxFileSystem is created for this account.

        After this call, most DbxFileSystem and DbxFile methods will fail with DbxException.ApiUsage. You should get a new instance one via forAccount(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxAccount).

        This method will have no effect if the DbxFileSystem is already shut down.

      • isShutDown

        public boolean isShutDown()
        Checks whether this instance has been shut down, either explicitly with a call to shutDown(), or implicitly when its account has been unlinked.
        Returns:
        whether or not this instance has been shut down.

      • getAccount

        public DbxAccount getAccount()
        Returns DbxAccount defining the Dropbox for this DbxFileSystem.

      • hasSynced

        public boolean hasSynced()
                  throws DbxException
        Returns whether the cached state has ever been synced since this application was first linked. Once the first sync is complete and there is a cached state available, this value will remain true even after a restart.

        Unlike awaitFirstSync() this method won't fail if the sync fails, but will continue to return false until a sync is successful.

        Returns:
        whether the cached state has ever been synced.
        Throws:
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.

      • awaitFirstSync

        public void awaitFirstSync()
                    throws DbxException
        Waits for the first sync of this cache to be complete (as defined by hasSynced(), so that valid metadata is available. Until the first sync is complete the Dropbox will appear to be empty.

        This method will stop waiting if the first sync fails, and will throw an exception indicating the sync failure.

        Throws:
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.

      • syncNowAndWait

        public void syncNowAndWait()
                    throws DbxException
        Starts a new sync of metadata from the server, and waits for it to complete, or throws if it fails.

        This method will stop waiting if the sync fails, and will throw an exception indicating the sync failure.

        Throws:
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.

      • getSyncStatus

        public DbxSyncStatus getSyncStatus()
                            throws DbxException
        Gets the status of background synchronization for this filesystem.
        Returns:
        the status of background synchronization for this filesystem.
        Throws:
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.

      • addSyncStatusListener

        public void addSyncStatusListener(DbxFileSystem.SyncStatusListener l)
                           throws DbxException
        Registers a listener that will be called when there is a change to the status of background synchronization, as returned by getSyncStatus().

        Adding the same listener more than once will have no effect. A single call to removeSyncStatusListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.SyncStatusListener) will cause it to no longer be called. This method will be ignored, and listeners won't be called if this filesystem is shut down.

        Parameters:
        l - the listener to register.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener is null.
        DbxException

      • removeSyncStatusListener

        public void removeSyncStatusListener(DbxFileSystem.SyncStatusListener l)
                              throws DbxException
        Removes a listener previously registered with addSyncStatusListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.SyncStatusListener).

        Calling this method with a listener that was never added will have no effect. This method will be ignored, and listeners won't be called if this filesystem is shut down.

        Parameters:
        l - the listener to register.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the listener is null.
        DbxException

      • addPathListener

        public void addPathListener(DbxFileSystem.PathListener l,
                   DbxPath path,
                   DbxFileSystem.PathListener.Mode mode)
        Registers a listener that will be called when there is a change to metadata or contents of a file or folder at the given path, or optionally to its children or descendants.

        The same listener can be registered for a different combination of path and type. Adding the same listener for the same combination will have no additional effect. A single call to removePathListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.PathListener, com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxPath, com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.PathListener.Mode) with the same combination will remove it.

        This method will be ignored, and listeners won't be called if this filesystem is shut down.

        Parameters:
        l - the listener to register.
        path - the path for which to listen.
        mode - the type of events for which to listen.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null.

      • removePathListener

        public void removePathListener(DbxFileSystem.PathListener l,
                      DbxPath path,
                      DbxFileSystem.PathListener.Mode mode)
        Unregisters a listener previously registered using addPathListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.PathListener, com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxPath, com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.PathListener.Mode).

        This will remove the given listener for the given combination of path and type only, having no effect on distinct registrations of the same listener. Calling this method for a listener and parameter combination that was never registered will have no effect.

        This method will be ignored, and listeners won't be called if this filesystem is shut down.

        Parameters:
        l - the listener to register.
        path - the path for which to listen.
        mode - the type of events for which to listen.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null.

      • removePathListenerForAll

        public void removePathListenerForAll(DbxFileSystem.PathListener l)
        Unregisters a listener previously registered using addPathListener(com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.PathListener, com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxPath, com.dropbox.sync.android.DbxFileSystem.PathListener.Mode), for all combinations of path and mode.

        This will have no effect if the given listener was never registered.

        Parameters:
        l - the listener to unregister.

        This method will be ignored, and listeners won't be called if this filesystem is shut down.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the arguments is null.

      • listFolder

        public java.util.List<DbxFileInfo> listFolder(DbxPath path)

        Lists the contents of a folder. This call will block to wait for the first sync to be complete before returning.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the folder.
        Returns:
        the info of all children of this folder.
        Throws:
        DbxException.NotFound - if the folder doesn't exist.
        DbxException.InvalidParameter - if the path refers to a file.
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.

        Checks whether a folder exists at the given path.

        Returns:
        true if a folder exists at the given path, or false if the given path doesn't exist or is a file.
        Throws:
        DbxException - if there is a failure getting metadata.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this instance has been stopped.

      • open

        public DbxFile open(DbxPath path)
             throws DbxException
        Opens a pre-existing file, at the latest cached revision if any exists, other at the latest known version. Opening a file will trigger a download of the latest version, and you can use methods on DbxFile to check the status of the download or switch to a newer revision when it becomes available.

        This method will fail if the same file is already open, or if the file doesn't exist.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file.
        Returns:
        the newly opened file.
        Throws:
        DbxException.NotFound - if the file doesn't exist, or is a folder.
        DbxException.InvalidParameter - if the path refers to a folder.
        DbxException.AlreadyOpen - if there is already a DbxFile open.
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.

      • create

        public DbxFile create(DbxPath path)
               throws DbxException
        Creates a new file, including any nonexistent parent folders. The new file will be available to write immediately, and you can use methods on DbxFile to check the status of the upload, or check for newer versions created on the server. This method will fail if the file already exists.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the file
        Returns:
        the newly created file.
        Throws:
        DbxException.Exists - if the file already exists, or one of its parents is a file rather than a folder.
        DbxException.InvalidParameter - if the path refers to a folder.
        DbxException.AlreadyOpen - if there is already a DbxFile open.
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.

      • createFolder

        public void createFolder(DbxPath folderPath)
                  throws DbxException
        Creates a new folder, including parent folders if necessary.
        Parameters:
        folderPath - the path to the new folder.
        Throws:
        DbxException.Exists - if there is a file in the way of the specified folder.
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.

        Parameters:

        Throws:
        DbxException.NotFound - if the given path doesn't exist.

        DbxException - if there is another failure.

      • move

        public void move(DbxPath oldPath,
        DbxPath newPath)
          throws DbxException
        Moves a file or folder, including its contents, to a new location.
        Parameters:
        oldPath - the path of the file or folder.
        newPath - the new path of the file or folder, including its new name.
        Throws:
        DbxException.NotFound - if the source path doesn't exist.
        DbxException.Exists - if one of the parents of the new path is a file rather than a folder.
        DbxException.InvalidParameter - if either given path is the root.
        DbxException.Unauthorized - if the user's account has been unlinked.
        DbxException.ApiUsage - if this filesystem has been shut down.
        DbxException - if there is another failure.
